title: Robert Indiana's LOVE Sculpture
content:
You know the one! [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love\_%28sculpture%29](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052807/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_%28sculpture%29)  
What's the font though?

Font: 

 Clarendon Black 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052807/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Lovestamp.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052807/http:/typophile.com/files/Lovestamp.png) | 42.82 KB |
author: braaad

comments.content: Robert Indiana may have started with [Clarendon Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052807/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/clarendon/black) ( [Sentinel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052807/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/sentinel/overview) is a recent re-interpretation of the classic Clarendon) tilting over /O. Some more suggestions from a [previous discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052807/http:/typophile.com/node/27607).
Thank Ryuk! I appreciate the link to the older thread as well.
